intro: Tractema pumila, commonly known as the smoothleaf lousewort, is a small flowering plant native to North America. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually covered in a fine, powdery coating. Its flowers are tiny, clustered in dense spikes, and range in color from white to pink. Tractema pumila is part of the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species.
